result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald William Durkee Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: civil judgment for unpaid court obligations

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF72 Pierce County

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA Sample. 
No contact with E.C.L and M.T.
Comply with Sex Offender Registry for 15 years and to commence after completion of probation.
Comply with any conditions imposed by Agent.

records.addlTxt: 11:35 Includes 15CF72 Defendant Ronald William Durkee in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Thorie states plea agreement was reached & files Amended Information on both cases. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. 15CF71 Count 1 of amended information DEF PLEADS GUILTY  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Case 15CF72 Count 1 of Amended Information  DEF PLEADS GUILTY COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND  WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Victim witness coordinator reads statements. Atty Thorie makes statement. Atty Nelson makes statement. Court addresses the parties.  Court accepts plea agreement & orders S/W 3 years probation, $515.00 court costs to be paid, DNA sample, No contact with ECL & MT. Court orders defendant comply with sexual registration 15 years, to commence after completion of probation. Atty Thorie has 30 days to file restitution paperwork, defendant has 10 days to schedule hearing on restitution. 12:09
Status conference on April 18, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Status conference at 03-28-2016 11:00 am.

10:42  This includes 15CF72 Defendant Ronald William Durkee in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie states they are not ready to address this case today. Nelson requests a status hearing be set.  Court argees for a status/plea hearing about 6 weeks out. Bond continues and Judge reviews conditions with the defendant.
Plea hearing at 02-08-2016 10:15 am.
Pre-trial conference at 11-30-2015 02:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 09-21-2015 09:00 am.
State's
Pre-trial conference at 07-23-2015 02:45 pm.

Information Filed with the Court for 15CF71 and 15CF72 and a copy is given to the defendant.    Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea to ct 1 for 15CF71 and ct 1 for 15CF72 at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court for ct 1 for 15CF71 and ct 1 for 15CF72.    Pretrial Conference to be set.  The bond will continue as ordered.  Court reviews bond conditions with defendant.  No contact to continue.  Thorie asks for no contact with Dairy Queen in Ellsworth. Bond to be amended prohibiting  entry into Dairy Queen in Ellsworth, Wisconsin.   Provision to be added to bonds.  New bonds to be signed by defendant.

11:20 a.m.  Includes 15CF72.  Defendant Ronald William Durkee in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing  The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
